legalDocuments.title: Terms & Conditions
legalDocuments.content:
Effective Date: Date of User Registration on the Platform

RdAid (“we,” “us,” or “our”) is committed to protecting the privacy and security of your personal information. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our mobile application (“App”) and the services offered through it.

1. Information We Collect

We may collect various types of information when you use our App, including:

  • Personal Information: This may include your name, email address, phone number, vehicle information (make, model, license plate), payment information, and any other information you provide when using our services.
  • Location Information: We may collect your device’s location data to provide roadside assistance services and improve our service quality.
  • Usage Information: We may collect information about how you interact with our App, such as the features you use, your preferences, and your device information (e.g., device type, operating system).
  • Communication Data: This includes information exchanged with our customer support team, feedback, and any other communications with us.

2. How We Use Your Information

We may use the information we collect for various purposes, including but not limited to:

  • Providing and improving our roadside assistance services.
  • Processing your requests and transactions.
  • Communicating with you about our services, updates, promotions, and other relevant information.
  • Personalizing your experience and tailoring our services to your preferences.
  • Analyzing usage trends and improving the functionality and performance of our App.
  • Complying with legal and regulatory requirements.

3. Information Sharing and Disclosure

We may share your information with third parties in the following circumstances:

  • With service providers and business partners who assist us in providing and improving our services.
  • With your consent or as otherwise required by law.
  • In connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets, where your information may be transferred to the new owner or successor entity.
  • To protect our rights, property, or safety, or the rights, property, or safety of others.

4. Data Security

We take reasonable measures to protect your information from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is completely secure, so we cannot guarantee absolute security.

5. Your Choices

You may choose not to provide certain information, but this may limit or prevent you from accessing certain features or services of our App. You can also update or delete your information by contacting us.

6. Children's Privacy

Our services are not directed to children under the age of 13, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe we have inadvertently collected information from a child, please contact us immediately.

7. Changes to this Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time, and any changes will be posted on this page with a revised effective date. We encourage you to review this Policy periodically for any updates.

Contact Us:

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

support@rdaid.com

legalDocuments.title: Privacy Policy
legalDocuments.content:
Effective Date: Date of User Registration on the Platform

RDAID, Inc. ('RDAID,' 'we,' 'our,' or 'us') is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your personal information when you use our website and mobile application (together, the 'Platform'). This includes our website located at www.rdaidflow.com.

1. Information We Collect

We collect the following types of information:

1.1. Personal Information:
  1. Full name
  2. Email address
  3. Phone number
  4. Physical address
  5. Date of birth
  6. Payment details (e.g., credit card, billing address)
1.2. Technical Information:
  1. IP address, browser type, device type, and operating system
  2. Geolocation data (e.g., GPS coordinates)
  3. Device identifiers
  4. Access logs and user activity
1.3. Service and Usage Information:
  1. Service requests and transaction history
  2. Ratings, reviews, and user feedback
  3. Interactions with support
1.4. Analytics and Advertising Data:
  1. Usage patterns
  2. Clickstream data
  3. Third-party cookies and tracking pixels (e.g., Google Analytics, Meta Pixel)
1.5. Sensitive Personal Data (If Applicable):
  1. Biometric data for authentication (processed locally, not stored)

2. How We Use Your Information

We use your information to:

  1. Facilitate service connections between users and providers
  2. Process payments and manage billing
  3. Send notifications, updates, and customer support
  4. Prevent fraud, enforce legal terms, and comply with law
  5. Improve and personalize user experience
  6. Serve personalized advertisements (where permitted)

3. How We Share Your Information

We may share your data with:

  1. Third-party service providers (e.g., payment processors, hosting services)
  2. Analytics and advertising partners
  3. Law enforcement or regulatory authorities when legally required
  4. Successors in the event of a business sale, merger, or acquisition
  5. We do not sell your personal information.

4. Your California Privacy Rights (CCPA)

If you are a California resident, you may:

  1. Request to know what personal information we collect and disclose
  2. Request deletion of your personal data (with exceptions)
  3. Opt-out of the 'sale' of personal data (we do not sell data as defined under CCPA)
  4. To exercise these rights, email us at: privacy@rdaid.com.
  5. We will verify your request and respond within legally required timeframes.

5. Data Security

We implement technical and organizational safeguards, including:

  1. Role-based access controls
  2. Regular audits and vulnerability assessments

6. Data Retention and Deletion

We retain your information as long as necessary to provide services, comply with laws, or resolve disputes. You may request deletion by emailing privacy@rdaid.com.

7. Children's Privacy

Our Platform is not intended for users under 18. We do not knowingly collect data from minors. If we learn we have, we will delete it immediately.

8. International Transfers

We do not knowingly transfer personal data outside the United States. If this changes, we will update this policy and ensure adequate safeguards are in place.

9. Cookies and Tracking Technologies

We use cookies and similar technologies to:

  1. Remember preferences
  2. Improve Platform performance
  3. Deliver personalized content and ads
  4. You may modify cookie preferences in your browser. Disabling cookies may affect Platform functionality.

10. Access to Camera, Video, Microphone, and Biometric Data

  1. Camera: Used for uploading photos related to services or identity verification.
  2. Video: You may upload videos for documentation or dispute resolution, with your consent.
  3. Microphone: Used for voice messaging or real-time support. Optional and controlled by your device settings.
  4. Biometric Authentication: For login purposes only. Biometric data is processed locally and not stored by RDAID.

11. Do Not Track and Opt-Out Mechanisms

We respect browser-based 'Do Not Track' signals where applicable. You can also:

  1. Opt-out of targeted advertising through the DAA's consumer choice tool)
  2. Adjust ad preferences on third-party platforms

12. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may revise this policy. The 'Effective Date' will be updated. Continued use after changes indicates acceptance.

13. Contact Us

RDAID Inc, 7818 N Cameron Ave, Tampa, Florida 33614, Email: privacy@rdaid.com.

By using our Platform, including www.rdaidflow.com, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agreed to this Privacy Policy
